Articles.Content: My rockets are using my lander fuel en-route to the Mun. Forcing the little Kerbals to be stranded for future rescue missions. After making the burn to descend and land. I separated lander only to find out it has 1/2 fuel capacity. Rockets were used somewhere from liftoff to separation for landing.
Just disable fuel transfer in docking port.

It’s a known and bizarre bug. Try removing the landing legs from your lander to see if it stops the draining.

If it does, put your legs on something other than a fuel tank, and put a decoupler between that part and the tanks. That worked for me.

I hope they’ll fix it soon. They said they’re working on fuel flow at top priority so maybe this will get addressed at the same time.

ive seen this too. seems your fuel will pass through a decoupler, ignoring the setting, if there isnt also an engine above it in the stack. i already posted it on bug reports. you can try putting another part above it, like a battery or something, or use a single engine instead of some spiders. 

Edited February 26, 2023 by Nuke
